{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3151834,"name":"Elliot Scher","username":"Gandagorn","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gandagorn/{size}/267112_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-24T14:21:31.788Z","cooked":"

So, on my double solenoid, when I press the toggle button on my controller, the light switches to the other side, indicating the air should be moving the other channel. The problem is that the piston doesn’t fire. We have it all tubed up correctly because there is air in the tubes attached to the piston. Could it be a bad solenoid? Thanks!!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2023-02-24T14:21:31.788Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":30,"reads":90,"readers_count":89,"score":168.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":427943,"topic_slug":"solenoid-switches-but-piston-doesnt-fire","display_username":"Elliot Scher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49423,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2815A (19-23) | 190M (23...)"},"post_url":"/t/solenoid-switches-but-piston-doesnt-fire/427943/1","custom_user_title":"2815A (19-23) | 190M (23...)","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3151851,"name":"NewtonCrosby","username":"NewtonCrosby","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/ed8c4c/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-24T14:43:45.467Z","cooked":"

Have you verified you have your PCM and your solenoids at the same voltage?
It it’s a PCM from CTRE, make sure your 12/24v jumper is correct.

We are using the Rev Pneumatic Hub

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2023-02-24T14:54:18.789Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":81,"readers_count":80,"score":16.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":427943,"topic_slug":"solenoid-switches-but-piston-doesnt-fire","display_username":"Sumter Link","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":31346,"username":"NewtonCrosby","name":"NewtonCrosby","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/ed8c4c/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":34765,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/solenoid-switches-but-piston-doesnt-fire/427943/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3151868,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-24T14:56:08.604Z","cooked":"

In addition to checking the voltage, some solenoids with manual activation buttons have a locking feature (eg can be locked with a quarter turn or similar). And just to confirm, the system is pressurized with at least 20 psi and the plumbing of input to output is correct? A picture might help.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2023-02-24T14:56:08.604Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":74,"readers_count":73,"score":29.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":427943,"topic_slug":"solenoid-switches-but-piston-doesnt-fire","display_username":"Peter Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13575,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA"},"post_url":"/t/solenoid-switches-but-piston-doesnt-fire/427943/4","custom_user_title":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3151876,"name":"Jon Stratis","username":"Jon_Stratis","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jon_stratis/{size}/2663_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-24T15:06:42.665Z","cooked":"

Check the voltage of your solenoids, then check that this is set correctly:

24V solenoids will light up from 12V control, but not actually fire.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2023-02-24T15:06:42.665Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":71,"readers_count":70,"score":54.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":427943,"topic_slug":"solenoid-switches-but-piston-doesnt-fire","display_username":"Jon Stratis","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7968,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 2177 Mentor, LRI, MN RPC"},"post_url":"/t/solenoid-switches-but-piston-doesnt-fire/427943/5","custom_user_title":"FRC 2177 Mentor, LRI, MN RPC","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":true,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3151881,"name":"Nate Laverdure (he/him)","username":"Nate_Laverdure","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nate_laverdure/{size}/134005_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-24T15:10:20.910Z","cooked":"

If it is a brand-new solenoid fresh from the factory, the spool could be in an intermediate state between the two extreme ends. Try pressing the buttons for the pilot valves and see if it will shuttle the spool around inside.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2023-02-24T15:10:20.910Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":67,"readers_count":66,"score":33.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":427943,"topic_slug":"solenoid-switches-but-piston-doesnt-fire","display_username":"Nate Laverdure (he/him)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":4999,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Cynicism isn't wisdom"},"post_url":"/t/solenoid-switches-but-piston-doesnt-fire/427943/6","custom_user_title":"Cynicism isn't wisdom","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3151925,"name":"Josh (he/him)","username":"Josh_Fox","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/josh_fox/{size}/119506_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-24T16:24:45.160Z","cooked":"

There is also likely a minimum operating pressure for your valve, make sure you’re providing that.

The solenoids on your valve can’t actually shift the spool without utilizing this pressure due to how they function internally.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2023-02-24T16:24:45.160Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":51,"readers_count":50,"score":20.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":427943,"topic_slug":"solenoid-switches-but-piston-doesnt-fire","display_username":"Josh (he/him)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":8270,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Detroiter"},"post_url":"/t/solenoid-switches-but-piston-doesnt-fire/427943/7","custom_user_title":"Detroiter","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3152004,"name":"Al Skierkiewicz Learn Something New, Every Day!","username":"Al_Skierkiewicz","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/al_skierkiewicz/{size}/110877_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-24T18:34:16.380Z","cooked":"

As Josh pointed out, make sure that your working pressure regulator is correctly set. Most piloted valves I have seen used on robots, will not be reliable at 40 psi or below. Remember that in piloted valves, the valve action is provided by the supply air moving the piston internally to the valve.
